Electric utilities In seven
southwestern states are under
taking a joint preliminary study
Of the future power requirements
of the area, announced Walter
Luchng, president Of Arizona
Public Service Company.


1t will investigate the posi-
bilities Of coordinated planning.
construction and operation of
generating and transmission IA
cilides to provide low cost power
in an orderly and economic man

Advertisements appearing In
various newspapers held out the
lure of high-paying jobs over
seas. You could earn up to $500
a month while enjoying adventure
with little or no taxes" abroad,
under excellent living conditions.


All you had to do was pay a
fee Of $3.50 to a promoter
salesman of Overseas Applica-
ton Service and sit back and wait
for your new job. And wait and
wait, situation that aroused the
interest of Better Business Bu-
reau and the Inspection Service
Of the Post Office Department.
For no one got a job.


almost all firms with over
seas operations do their own
Job recruitment" warns Chief
Postal Inspector Henry B. Mon
tague. "Those who do not, usually
rely on established employment
agencies. When a fee Is de-
manded in advance from a sales
man who is in your town only
for a few days and who has an
office in his hotel room, the lob

nGrs


Utilities joining in the study
are Arizona Public Service Com
pany. Ell Paso Electric Company.
Nevada Power Company, Public
Service Company of Colorado,
Public Service Company Of New
Mexico, San Diego Gas and Elec-
trio Company, Sierra Pacific
Power Company. Southern Cali
forma Edison Company. Tue
son Gas, Electric Light and Pow
er Company and Utah Power and
Light Company.

applicant should be wary"


Overseas Application Service,
which operated out Of a post
office box in Denver, Is out Of
business now and its three opera
tors have been sentenced to pri-
son after an eight day trial in
Denver on charges Of mail fraud.


Sentenced were Roy E. Cusow
and Melvin L. Shapiro, both Of
New York, who drew terms Of
two and one-half years, and DON
aid H. Oransky. Of Portland,
Maine. whose sentence is one and
one-half years. Upon termina-
ton Of the jail sentences, the men
are placed on probation for three
and one-half years, during which
the court stipulated that they must
not participate in any shady pro-
motion schemes.


Statesmen for Overseas Appli-
cation Service, Witnesses said,
inferred that the organizationhad
influential contacts overseas and
that 1t would forward ten Job
applications for every $3.50 fee
paid.

Last year beside the profit that
was put into the Council Camp
Fund. Sill 900 went to the 800
individual troops to help with
troop camping and with Day Camp
fees. Girl Scouts camped all over
Arizona and saved their money
for trips to California and
Mexico.


This year, Brownie Girl Scouts
will not sell cookies. Since
Brownies are younger group
under the new program, they will
practice being good saleswomen
until they are old enough to be
Junior Girl Scouts.


So, when the Girl Scout inyour
neighborhood knocks onyour door
or the Girl Scout in the neigh
borhood booth approaches you =
buy cookies for camping and
character.

and in floors above unheated
spaces.


The mineral wool not only adds
to winter comfort and heating
economy, but also helps keep
classroOms cool and students
sharp during late-spring and
early fall hot spells.

Comfort Now Added
To TOday's Schools

Recent school designs stress
the Importance of comfort in
helping students to do their best.
An example of this is the increas-
ing use of a modern electric heat
ing system coupled with mineral
wool insulation in walls, ceilings

until they are old enough to be

So, when the Girl Scout inyour
